summary: U.S. employees and their families overseas often work and live in stressful environments with limited or no access to local mental health services. While the State Department and U.S. Agency for International Development offer some mental health services, providers and patients we surveyed identified challenges in delivering or accessing them. For example, providers reported increased workloads amid growing demand for services. State has collected feedback...
title: Mental Health Services: State Should Collect Ongoing Feedback to Ensure Overseas Employees' Needs Are Being Met
